pr_title: Better logging for Python Docker environment

timeline.message: better logging for py Docker environment

timeline.bodyText: This would be a good place to tell the user how to provide an image if they want to.
timeline.author: ibzib
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -240,15 +240,16 @@ def __init__(
     super(DockerEnvironment, self).__init__(capabilities, artifacts)
     if container_image:
       logging.info(
-        'Using provided Python SDK container image: %s' % (container_image))
+          'Using provided Python SDK container image: %s' % (container_image))
       self.container_image = container_image
     else:
-      logging.info('No image given - inferring default Python SDK container image')
+      logging.info(
+          'No image given - inferring default Python SDK container image')

replies.bodyText: hmm I'm not sure it's a good idea to link the possible env/runner flags to the log message here, but at least changed the wording a bit
replies.author: emilymye

replies.bodyText: I prefer not to say container_image since it could be misconstrued as a flag. Best to leave it how you had it originally.
replies.author: ibzib

timeline.author: tvalentyn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -312,9 +319,7 @@ def default_docker_image():
     image = (
         'apache/beam_python{version_suffix}_sdk:{tag}'.format(
             version_suffix=version_suffix, tag=sdk_version))
-    logging.info(
-        'Using Python SDK docker image: %s. If the image is not '
-        'available at local, we will try to pull from hub.docker.com' % (image))
+    logging.info('Default Python SDK image for environment is %s' % (image))
